page.title: 07Market day in Heathylee
page.content: Transporters for the cattle markets are Jeff Mellor, Bert Proctor, Sam Garlic, Eric Williams, Donny Moss, Glen Garlic and many others. They will take your cows, sheep, goats, horses, pigs, foals, sometimes donkeys, calves, lambs, bulls and bullocks. If you can't get there yourself they will take you as well. The price you pay is about 15 pounds and if you want to bring some back they will bring them back for you if you pay them some more money. The cattle market days are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday. There are pens for the animals to wait in. The milking cows get chained up in a different part. The bulls get chained up with the cows. The seats are made of bricks and wooden tops. Some people give a lucky quid. The calves are in a different part as well.
